content.title: Intro
content.content:

Year

1913

Tolkien-related events that took place in 1912.

content.title: January
content.content: 20 - Vincent Trought, a member of the T.C.B.S., dies. He had been severely ill since the autumn.

content.title: April
content.content: 5 - John Le Mesurier, who would voice Bilbo in the 1981 radio adaptation of The Lord of the Rings, is born.

content.title: May
content.content:
18 - J.R.R. Tolkien pays his Oxford Union Library fees.
31 - German translator Margaret Carroux is born.

content.title: December
content.content: ? - J.R.R. Tolkien creates the illustration End of the World.

content.title: Unknown
content.content:
The Apolausticks are founded at Oxford.
Years
1909 1910 1911 1912 1913 1914 1915
